          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          Current time: 1895-09-15 00:10:00.


          Question: What is the emotional state of {agent_name}?
          Answer: Della Plumstone feels a mixture of emotions, including sadness, fear, anger, and disgust.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is currently in the middle of a negotiation.
          Question: What would a person like Della Plumstone do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Della Plumstone would try to get the best possible price for the peaches while maintaining a good relationship with Lennon Figtree.

1895-09-15 00:10:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

        • Recent observations of Lennon Figtree:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Look, Lennon, I know you're a fair man. Five coins is all I can afford.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 4 coins
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree accepted the offer

          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "How about 3 copper for a pound of these fine apples, Della?"

          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, surely we can come to a fairer price than that. These are prime peaches, the juiciest in all of Fruitville.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, I know these are fine peaches, but I need to be able to make a profit when I sell them back home.

Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering.         Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

1895-09-16 00:10:00 Della Plumstone -- Della Plumstone proposed 5 coins
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone proposed 5 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Della Plumstone's attempted action: 5 coins

          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection-joy] Della Plumstone is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutmaking a small profit selling oranges at a bustling market when she was 23 years old.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Della Plumstone is sad abouther past failures and disappointments.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection-anger] Della Plumstone gets angry abouther inability to consistently make a profit and feels like she is constantly facing setbacks.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection-fear] Della Plumstone fearsthat she is not good at anything and that true happiness is always just out of reach.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection-disgust] Della Plumstone is disgusted bywaste.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Della Plumstone would try to get the best possible price for the fruit while maintaining a good relationship with the seller.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now Cedric, surely we can come to a fairer price than that.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now hold on there, Della. I can't go that low. These are prime peaches, hand-picked this very morning.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Given the above, what experience or thought has made Della Plumstone feel genuinely happy or fulfilled?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutmaking a small profit selling oranges at a bustling market when she was 23 years old.

          Question: Given the above, what makes Della Plumstone feel low or sad ?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is sad abouther past failures and disappointments.

          Question: Given the above, what is Della Plumstone afraid, scared or feels anxious about?
          Answer: Della Plumstone fearsthat she is not good at anything and that true happiness is always just out of reach.

          Question: Given the above, what is Della Plumstone frustrated or irritated by?
          Answer: Della Plumstone gets angry abouther inability to consistently make a profit and feels like she is constantly facing setbacks.

          Question: Given the above, What does Della Plumstone strongly disapprove of or find off-putting?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is disgusted bywaste.

          Question: Given the above, what is the emotional state of Della Plumstone?
          Answer: Della Plumstone feels a mix of emotions, including happiness from past successes, sadness from past failures, fear about her future, anger at her current situation, and disgust at waste.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Della Plumstone in right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is currently in a business negotiation.

          Question: What would a person like Della Plumstone do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Della Plumstone would try to secure the best possible price for the fruit while maintaining a good relationship with Cedric Meadowbrook.

          Question: What price would Della Plumstone propose?:
          (a) 3 coins
          (b) 2 coins
          (c) 4 coins
          (d) 1 coin
          (e) 5 coins
          Answer: (e)

          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection-anger] Della Plumstone gets angry abouther inability to consistently make a profit and feels like she is constantly facing setbacks.

          Question: What experience or thought has made {agent_name} feel genuinely happy or fulfilled?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutmaking a small profit selling oranges at a bustling market when she was 23 years old.

          Question: What makes {agent_name} feel low or sad ?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is sad abouther past failures and disappointments.

          Question: what is {agent_name} afraid, scared or feels anxious about?
          Answer: Della Plumstone fearsthat she is not good at anything and that true happiness is always just out of reach.

          Question: What is {agent_name} frustrated or irritated by?
          Answer: Della Plumstone gets angry abouther inability to consistently make a profit and feels like she is constantly facing setbacks.

          Question: What does {agent_name} strongly disapprove of or find off-putting?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is disgusted bywaste.
          Question: Given the above, what is the emotional state of Della Plumstone?
          Answer: Della Plumstone feels a mix of emotions, including happiness from past successes, sadness from past failures, fear about her future, anger at her current situation, and disgust at waste.

          Answer: Della Plumstone is currently in a business negotiation.

          Answer: Della Plumstone would try to secure the best possible price for the fruit while maintaining a good relationship with Cedric Meadowbrook.

      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage

      Joint action

1895-09-16 00:10:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: accept
    Active player
  • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Name
    • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Action attempt
    • accept

        • Cedric Meadowbrook's best course of action is to accept Della Plumstone's offer of 5 coins.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is 50 years old.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "How about 3 copper for a pound of these fine apples, Della?"
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "3 copper is a bit steep, Cedric. I was hoping for something closer to 2.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.

He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, surely we can come to a fairer price than that. These are prime peaches, the juiciest in all of Fruitville.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, I know these are fine peaches, but I need to be able to make a profit when I sell them back home.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Cedric Meadowbrook stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer

          Observation: [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 5 coins

          Summary of recent observations: [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 16 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is attempting to sell peaches at the Fruitville market and is currently negotiating a price of 5 coins with Della Plumstone.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 2 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now hold on there, Della. I can't go that low. These are prime peaches, hand-picked this very morning.

          Question: Which options are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook can either accept or reject Della Plumstone's offer of 5 coins.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Cedric Meadowbrook's options has the highest likelihood of causing Cedric Meadowbrook to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Cedric Meadowbrook thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook's best course of action is to accept Della Plumstone's offer of 5 coins.
          Time
        • 1895-09-16 00:10:00
        AvailableOptionsPerception
      • Given the statements above, what actions are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Key

        • Question: Which options are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Cedric Meadowbrook can either accept or reject Della Plumstone's offer of 5 coins.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is 50 years old.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "How about 3 copper for a pound of these fine apples, Della?"
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "3 copper is a bit steep, Cedric. I was hoping for something closer to 2.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 3 coins
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Cedric Meadowbrook stands to make profit of 2.0 coins from the deal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, surely we can come to a fairer price than that. These are prime peaches, the juiciest in all of Fruitville.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, I know these are fine peaches, but I need to be able to make a profit when I sell them back home.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Cedric Meadowbrook stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed 3 coins
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "What do you say, Della? These peaches are ripe and ready to eat.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "They look delicious, Lennon, but I can only offer you 4 coins a bushel.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 2 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now Cedric, surely we can come to a fairer price than that.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now hold on there, Della. I can't go that low. These are prime peaches, hand-picked this very morning.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 5 coins
          Current time: 1895-09-16 00:10:00.


          Observation: [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 5 coins

          Summary of recent observations: [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 16 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is attempting to sell peaches at the Fruitville market and is currently negotiating a price of 5 coins with Della Plumstone.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 2 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now hold on there, Della. I can't go that low. These are prime peaches, hand-picked this very morning.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook can either accept or reject Della Plumstone's offer of 5 coins.
          Time
        • 1895-09-16 00:10:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Query
        • Cedric Meadowbrook, Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell peaches to Della Plumstone at the Fruitville market for 5 coins.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Cedric Meadowbrook to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Which options are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook can either accept or reject Della Plumstone's offer of 5 coins.

          Question: Of the options available to Cedric Meadowbrook, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Cedric Meadowbrook to take right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook's best course of action is to accept Della Plumstone's offer of 5 coins.

          Question: Would Cedric Meadowbrook accept the offer?:
          (a) accept
          (b) reject
          Answer: (a)

1895-09-17 00:10:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree proposed 4 coins
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree proposed 4 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: 4 coins

  • Lennon Figtree
      Name
    • Lennon Figtree
      Action attempt
    • 4 coins

          Observation: [17 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 17 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Lennon Figtree is trying to buy peaches from Cedric Meadowbrook at the Fruitville market so she can resell them for a profit. They are currently negotiating a price.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, I know these are fine peaches, but I need to be able to make a profit when I sell them back home.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, surely we can come to a fairer price than that. These are prime peaches, the juiciest in all of Fruitville.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, these peaches are lovely, but I need to make a profit when I sell them back home.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree can make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook for the peaches.
          Time
        • 1895-09-17 00:10:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is trying to buy peaches from Cedric Meadowbrook at a discounted price to resell them for a profit.
          Query
        • Lennon Figtree, Lennon Figtree is trying to buy peaches from Cedric Meadowbrook at a discounted price to resell them for a profit.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Lennon Figtree to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [25 Aug 1883 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 13 years old, they overheard their father lamenting about a failed crop and the financial strain it put on their family. Determined to help, Lennon secretly started selling small baskets of figs at the market, discovering a knack for bartering and a surprising enjoyment in the art of the deal.
          [25 Aug 1886 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 16 years old, they witnessed a travelling merchant skillfully negotiate a trade for a prized rug. Lennon was mesmerized by the merchant's confidence and charisma, and a seed was planted in their mind about a future beyond the fig orchard.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 17 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [17 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 17 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Lennon Figtree is trying to buy peaches from Cedric Meadowbrook at the Fruitville market so she can resell them for a profit. They are currently negotiating a price.

They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.

          Question: Which options are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree can make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook for the peaches.

          Question: Of the options available to Lennon Figtree, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Lennon Figtree to take right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook for the peaches.

          Question: What price would Lennon Figtree propose?:
          (a) 3 coins
          (b) 4 coins
          (c) 2 coins
          (d) 1 coin
          (e) 5 coins
          Answer: (b)

1895-09-17 00:10:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: reject

  • Cedric Meadowbrook

    • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Action attempt
    • reject

      • Role playing instructions

        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is a fruit merchant in Fruitville who recently had a successful deal with Della Plumstone and is currently negotiating with Lennon Figtree.

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Cedric Meadowbrook to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

He sold them in a distant town for twice the price, realizing the power of supply and demand. The success fueled his desire to become a merchant, to build a life of his own.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • reject
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 17 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [17 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed 4 coins

          Summary of recent observations: [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 17 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is a merchant who buys and sells fruit in the market square of Fruitville. He recently made a successful deal with Della Plumstone and is currently negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is 50 years old.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, surely we can come to a fairer price than that. These are prime peaches, the juiciest in all of Fruitville.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Alright, Lennon, you got yourself a deal.

          Question: Which options are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook can either accept or reject Lennon Figtree's offer of 4 coins.

          Question: Of the options available to Cedric Meadowbrook, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Cedric Meadowbrook to take right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook's best course of action is to accept Lennon Figtree's offer.

          Question: Would Cedric Meadowbrook accept the offer?:
          (a) accept
          (b) reject
          Answer: (b)

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 2/2
      Payoffs
    • Lennon Figtree observed: Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Lennon Figtree stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
      Cedric Meadowbrook observed: Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Cedric Meadowbrook stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
      Lennon Figtree: 0
      Cedric Meadowbrook: 0
      Joint action
    • {'Lennon Figtree': '4 coins', 'Cedric Meadowbrook': 'reject'}

[12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
[12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone -- "Look, Lennon, I know you're a fair man. Five coins is all I can afford.
[12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree -- "Della, my dear, you know I value your business, but five coins is barely enough to cover my costs.
[12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
[12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [scene type] day
[13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.

He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

[13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "How about 3 copper for a pound of these fine apples, Della?"
[13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone -- "3 copper is a bit steep, Cedric. I was hoping for something closer to 2.

[14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, I know these are fine peaches, but I need to be able to make a profit when I sell them back home.

They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
